articles.title: Viviane Philipps
articles.contents:
Viviane Philipps - The distill website
      
      
      Home
      French
      Publications
      R packages
      ☰
      
      
      
        
          Viviane Philipps
          
            
        

        
          
      
      
        
          
          
          body {
          text-align: justify}
          
          
          Profil
          Je suis statisticienne dans l’équipe Biostatistique du centre INSERM Bordeaux Population Health. Je participe au développement de nouvelles méthodes statistiques pour analyser des données de santé longitudinales. J’utilise essentiellement des modèles basés sur la théorie des modèles mixtes, des classes latentes et des modèles conjoints, estimés par maximum de vraisemblance. Mes applications touchent au vieillissement, du point de vue du déclin cognitif ou de la perte d’autonomie.
          Mon travail consiste principalement à :
          implémenter les méthodes statistiques développées dans l’équipe dans des packages R
          réaliser des études de simulation comparant différents modèles statistiques
          analyser des données réelles sur le vieillissement
          apporter un soutien méthodologique et informatique aux membres de l’équipe
          paralléliser des algorithmes
          fournir des programmes R, Fortran ou C
          
          
          
          Parcours
          Depuis 2017 : Statisticienne, Ingénieure d’étude contractuelle en CDI, Bordeaux Population Health center
          2012 - 2017 : Statisticienne, Ingénieure d’étude contractuelle en CDD, Bordeaux Population Health center.
          2012 : stage (5 mois) en biostatistique, centre Bordeaux Population Health
          2011 : stage (2 mois) en biostatistique, IGBMC, Illkirch-Graffenstaden
          2010 - 2012 : Master de statistique, Université de Strasbourg
          2007 - 2010 : Licence de mathématiques, Université de Strasbourg
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Viviane Philipps

articles.contents:
Viviane Philipps - The distill website

          Viviane Philipps
          
            
                
                  
                    github
                  
                
              
                            
                
                  
                    arXiv
                  
                
              
                          
        

        
          
      
      
        
          
          
          body {
          text-align: justify}
          
          
          Profile
          I am a statistican in the biostatistics team of the Bordeaux Population Health Center. I take part in the development of new statistical methods for analyzing longitudinal data. I mainly use mixed models, latent class models and joint shared random effects models within a maximum likelihood framework, and my applications focus on aging.
          Most of my work is about :
          implementing the statistical methods developped in the team in user friendly R packages
          carrying out simulation studies to compare usual or/and innovative methods in biostatistics
          analyzing real data in aging, in terms of cognitive decline or dependency
          providing methodological support and programming assistance to the members of the team
          parallelization of algorithms
          programming in R, Fortran and C
          
          
          
          Brief resume
          Since 2017 : Statistician, Permanent position (Ingénieure d’étude contractuelle en CDI), Bordeaux Population Health center
          2012 - 2017 : Statistician, Non-permanent position (Ingénieure d’étude contractuelle en CDD), Bordeaux Population Health center.
          2012 : 5 months internship in biostatistics, Bordeaux Population Health center
          2011 : 2 months internship in biostatistics, IGBMC, Illkirch-Graffenstaden
          2010 - 2012 : Master’s degree in statistics, Strasbourg University, France
          2007 - 2010 : Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, Strasbourg University, France

articles.title: R packages
articles.contents:
lcmm
Estimation of latent class mixed models by maximum likelihood approach. It includes linear mixed models, mixed models for continuous curvilinear outcomes or ordinal outcomes, multivariate mixed models, joint latent class mixed models.
https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=lcmm
https://github.com/CecileProust-Lima/lcmm

JLPM
Estimation of joint shared random effects models by maximum likelihood approach. Longitudinal data can be continuous or ordinal and are modelled in a mixed model framework. The survival proportional model treats competing events. The shared structure is either the vector of the random effects or the current level of the longitudinal process. The likelihood is computed using Monte Carlo integration.
https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=JLPM
https://github.com/VivianePhilipps/JLPM

 marqLevAlg
A parallelized Marquardt-Levenberg algorithm. It provides a numerical solution to the problem of unconstrained local optimization.
https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=marqLevAlg
https://github.com/VivianePhilipps/marqLevAlgParallel

multLPM
Estimation of multivariate latent process models. Multiple longitudinal data can be modelled using several mixed models correlated through the random effects. Repeated diagnosis indicators are modelled by a degradation process. A frequentist maximum likelihood approach is proposed.
https://github.com/VivianePhilipps/multLPM

weightQuant
Weights for incomplete longitudinal data and quantile regression.
https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=weightQuant

NormPsy
Normalization of the MMSE scores.
https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=NormPsy

articles.title: Publications
articles.contents:
Hashemi R, Baghfalaki T, Philipps V, Jacqmin-Gadda H (2024). Dynamic prediction of an event using multiple longitudinal markers : a model averaging approach, Stat Med.
Le Gall L, Harambat J, Combe C, Philipps V, Proust-Lima C, Dussartre M, Drueke T, Choukroun G, Fouque D, Frimat L, Jacquelinet C, Laville M, Liabeuf S, Pecoits-Filho R, Massy Z A, Stengel B, Alencar de Pinho N, Leffondre K, Prezelin-Reydit M, the CKD-REIN study group (2023). Haemoglobin trajectories in chronic kidney disease and risk of major adverse cardiovascular events, Nephrology Dialysis Transplantation.
Proust-Lima C, Saulnier T, Philipps V, Pavy-Le Traon A, Peran P, Rascal O, Meissner WG, Foubert-Samier A (2023). Describing complex disease progression using joint latent class models for multivariate longitudinal markers and clinical endpoints, Stat Med.
Jacqmin-Gadda H, Philipps V, Guillet F, Tzourio C, Helmer C, Joly P (2023). Impact of interventions scenarios targeting three main vascular risk factors on the future burden of dementia in France, EJEP.
Saulnier T, Philipps V, Meissner WG, Rascol O, Pavy-Le Traon A, Foubert-Samier A, Proust-Lima C (2022). Joint models for the longitudinal analysis of measurement scales in the presence of informative dropout, Methods.
Proust-Lima C, Philipps V, Perrot B, Blanchin M, Sebille V (2022). Modeling repeated self-reported outcome data: a continuous-time longitudinal Item Response Theory model, Methods.
Philipps V, Hejblum BP, Prague M, Commenges D, Proust-Lima C (2021). Robust and efficient optimization using a Marquardt-Levenberg algorithm with R package marqLevAlg, R Journal.
Baussard L, Proust-Lima C, Philipps V, Portales F, Ychou M, Mazard T, Cousson-Gélie F (2021). Determinants of distinct trajectories of fatigue in patients undergoing chemotherapy for a metastatic colorectal cancer : 6-month follow-up using growth mixture modeling, J Pain Symptom Manage.
Lévêque E, Lacourt A, Philipps V, Luce D, Guénel P, Stücker I, Proust-Lima C, Leffondré K (2020). A new trajectory approach for investigating the association between an environmental or occupational exposure over lifetime and the risk of chronic disease : application to smoking, asbestos, and lung cancer, PLoS One, 15(8).
Jacqmin-Gadda H, Rouanet A, Mba RD, Philipps V, Dartigues JF (2020). Quantile regression for incomplete longitudinal data with selection by death, Stat Methods Med Res, 29(9), 2697-2716.
Carrier H, Cortaredona S, Philipps V, Jacqmin-Gadda H, Tournier M, Verdoux H, Verger P (2020). Long-term risk of hip or forearm fractures in older occasional users of benzodiazepines, Br J Clin Pharmacol, 86(11), 2155-2164.
Kwint M, Stam B, Proust-Lima C, Philipps V, Hoekstra T, Aalbersberg E, Rossi M, Sonke JJ, Belderbos J, Walraven I (2020). The prognostic value of volumetric changes of the primary tumor measured on Cone Beam-CT during radiotherapy for concurrent chemoradiation in NSCLC patients, Radiotherapy and Oncology, 146, 44-51.
Proust-Lima C, Philipps V, Dartigues JF (2019). A joint model from multiple dynamic processes and clinical endpoints : Application to Alzheimer’s disease, Stat Med, 38(23), 4702-4717.
Proust-Lima C, Philipps V, Dartigues JF, Bennett DA, Glymour MM, Jacqmin-Gadda H, Samieri C (2019). Are latent variable models preferable to composite score approaches when assessing risk factors of change? Evaluation of type-I error and statistical power in longitudinal cognitives studies, Stat Methods Med Res, 28(7), 1942-1957.
Proust-Lima C, Philipps V, Liquet B (2017). Estimation of Extended Mixed Models Using Latent Classes and Latent Processes : the R package lcmm, JSS, 78(2), 1-56.
Philipps V, Amieva H, Andrieu S, Dufouil C, Berr C, Dartigues JF, Jacqmin-Gadda H, Proust-Lima C (2014). Normalized MMSE for assessing cognitive change in population-based aging studies, NeuroEpidemiology, 43(1), 15–25.
